arts.ttl: Leeds open talks with Porto over transfer of 27-year-old defender; player keen on move
arts.sum: Leeds United’s hopes of securing automatic promotion to the Premier League suffered a blow this week, as the club dropped from first to third in the Championship standings. Just a single point separates them from second-placed Sheffield United, while Burnley sit narrowly ahead at the summit. With only six fixtures remaining in the regular season, […] The post Leeds open talks with Porto over transfer of 27-year-old defender; player keen on move appeared first on CaughtOffside.

arts.ttl: 'Not great' - Luton chief assess Adebayo's injury after Town striker hobbles off
arts.sum: Forward replaced early in the second half against Leeds

arts.ttl: Leeds fans get last laugh as Sheffield United fluff their lines in major promotion twist
arts.sum: Leeds opened the door for their promotion rivals as their poor form continued at Luton but Sheffield United couldn't take advantage as they were stunned at Oxford

arts.ttl: Leeds United fears realised vs Luton as Daniel Farke question goes unanswered
arts.sum: Burnley beating Coventry City 2-1 has seen them jump above Leeds by two points while Sheffield United remain ahead having played a game fewer. Leeds United have slipped back into the play-offs following today's 1-1 draw at Luton Town .

arts.ttl: Luton claim a crucial point against title-chasing Leeds United
Championship roundup: Burnley seize advantage as Luton hold Leeds
arts.sum: Burnley triumph 2-1 at Coventry to go top Leeds’s stutter goes on after 1-1 draw at Kenilworth Road Burnley moved to the top of the Championship after Jaidon Anthony’s double secured a 2-1 victory at Coventry, while Leeds missed the chance to return to the summit after a 1-1 draw at Luton. Sheffield United, the overnight leaders, were playing at Oxford in the 3pm kick-offs. Haji Wright controversially opened the scoring early on for Coventry before Anthony struck either side of half-time to extend Burnley’s unbeaten league run to 27 matches. Burnley’s victory also handed Coventry back-to-back league defeats for the first time since Frank Lampard took charge of the Sky Blues in late November. The former England midfielder was also sent off after full-time for confronting the referee, James Bell, after the final whistle. Continue reading...

arts.ttl: Daniel Farke makes Manor Solomon admission as Leeds United boss delivers Luton Town verdict
arts.sum: Daniel Farke declared himself satisfied with a point from Leeds United's clash at Luton Town today. It's a good point on the road and it helps us for the upcoming games."

arts.ttl: Leeds fall to third as they stumble again in draw at Luton
arts.sum: Leeds dropped out of the Championship automatic-promotion spots after they were held to a 1-1 draw by struggling Luton at Kenilworth Road.

arts.ttl: Leeds continue to stumble in promotion race after draw at Luton
Man Utd wonderkid scores SIX times in first half as U18s make history vs Leeds
arts.sum: Victor Musa is being tipped for great things at Manchester United and he underlined his huge potential by scoring six times in just 45 minutes in a stunning 3-1 victory over Leeds for the Under-18s
